channel.title: BBC News - Asia
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Is China's vaccine success waning in Asia?
item.description: Thailand and Indonesia's switch to other Covid jabs has raised questions about Chinese vaccines.

item.title: Katie Hopkins to be deported from Australia over quarantine rules
item.description: Katie Hopkins - a right-wing British commentator - bragged about plans to break isolation rules.

item.title: Carlos Ghosn: Father and son sentenced for helping ex-Nissan boss escape
item.description: Michael and Peter Taylor were convicted of helping ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn escape Japan in 2019.

item.title: Indian parliament opens amid Pegasus spyware row
item.description: Spyware from an Israeli firm was allegedly used to hack phones of Indian MPs and journalists.

item.title: Protesting India farmers brave cold, heat and Covid
item.description: Seven months on, farmers are still striking against contentious new laws outside the national capital.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'Plague of oysters' threaten key venue
item.description: More than $1m has been spent to keep tonnes of rogue shellfish at bay in Tokyo's Sea Forest Waterway.

item.title: Athletes test positive for Covid at Olympic village
item.description: Two South Africa footballers test positive for Covid-19 in the Olympic village, while eight Team GB athletes and staff isolating as close contacts.

item.title: Daughter of Afghan envoy kidnapped and injured in Pakistan
item.description: Afghan officials urge Pakistan to keep diplomats safe, amid tensions between the two neighbours.

item.title: Dying alone in Indonesia's grim battle with Covid-19
item.description: Firefighters haul bodies from homes as hospitals scramble for oxygen in Asia's new Covid epicentre.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: How quiet rebel Naomi Osaka is changing Japan
item.description: Naomi Osaka's relationship with Japan has not always been easy, but change rarely is. How the face of the Games is changing the host nation.

item.title: Korindo: Korean palm oil giant stripped of sustainability status
item.description: A BBC investigation found Korindo had been buying and burning swathes of Asia's largest rainforests.

item.title: Viewpoint: Why Sikhs celebrate kindness
item.description: A new book asks why Sikhs have made it a tradition to help strangers in their darkest moments.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The gymnasts 'building bridges between cultures'
item.description: The town of Murayama in northern Japan is preparing to welcome a team of Bulgarian Olympians.

item.title: Gujarat: The Indian baby who was abducted twice
item.description: The disappearance of a two-day-old baby was the start of a case that crossed state lines in India.

item.title: Australian campaign to improve education about sexual consent
item.description: Thousands of stories have emerged of Australian students sexually assaulted by fellow pupils.

item.title: Uttar Pradesh bill: The myth of India's population explosion
item.description: India's most populous state has a contentious plan for curbing population growth. But is it necessary?

item.title: In numbers: Life in Afghanistan after America leaves
item.description: How did 20 years of war between the US and the Taliban change Afghanistan?

item.title: Covid: What do we know about China's coronavirus vaccines?
item.description: Sinovac and Sinopharm jabs are being used in many countries that are seeing a surge of infections.

item.title: Plastic surgery booming in China despite the dangers
item.description: Young people are using social media apps to plan cosmetic procedures which don't always meet expectations.

item.title: Afghan woman 'unbroken' after being shot by her husband
item.description: Afghan woman Shakila Zareen had to have 22 operations after being shot in the face by her husband.
